memories.summary: On January 12, 2025, in Ann Arbor, Leo packed winter clothes at a donation drive, smiling as volunteers sorted coats into boxes.
On February 20, 2025, in Detroit, Leo helped serve meals at a community shelter, chatting with guests at long wooden tables.
On March 8, 2025, in Chicago, Leo attended an environmental awareness rally, holding a handmade sign that read 'Act Now for Our Planet.'
On April 17, 2025, in Washington D.C., Leo joined a climate policy conference, taking notes during a panel on renewable energy initiatives.
On May 25, 2025, in New Orleans, Leo helped rebuild homes damaged by flooding, painting walls with a local volunteer group.
On June 21, 2025, in San Francisco, Leo gave a short speech at a sustainability summit, highlighting the importance of community recycling programs.
On July 30, 2025, in Nairobi, Leo joined an NGO field project, distributing clean water filters in a rural village with local volunteers.
On September 4, 2025, in Rio de Janeiro, Leo participated in a beach cleanup event, collecting plastic waste along the shoreline.
On October 19, 2025, in Toronto, Leo met youth leaders at a social impact forum, exchanging ideas about environmental education.
On December 14, 2025, in Ann Arbor, Leo spoke at a local school assembly, encouraging students to volunteer in their communities.

qa_pairs.question: Which causes did Leo support through his volunteer work?
qa_pairs.answer_gold: He contributed to homelessness relief, flood recovery, climate activism, environmental cleanup, and humanitarian water projects.

qa_pairs.question: Which international volunteer activities did Leo participate in?
qa_pairs.answer_gold: He joined a clean water project in Nairobi and a beach cleanup in Rio de Janeiro.

qa_pairs.question: What shows Leo's shift from volunteer work to advocacy and leadership?
qa_pairs.answer_gold: He started by serving meals and rebuilding homes, then gave speeches at summits, joined policy conferences, and later inspired students through talks.

qa_pairs.question: Who collaborated with Leo in his volunteer work, and where?
qa_pairs.answer_gold: Sarah at the Detroit shelter, David in New Orleans, Omar in Nairobi, Maya in Rio, and Rachel at the climate conference in D.C.

qa_pairs.question: Which memory best captures Leo's role as a community motivator?
qa_pairs.answer_gold: His school assembly talk in Ann Arbor, where he encouraged students to engage in volunteering.
